group_1.textLeft: Urara!

group_1.textRight: And Kurara's!

group_1.textLeft: We're bringing you today's show from our usual@recording studio!
I never imagined Professor Satomi would appear@on this show...

group_1.textRight: We've really ended up relying on it as our means@of communicating with everyone, haven't we...

group_1.textCenter: But, no matter what a third party may say,
we've already confessed our guilt in the@prior broadcast...

group_1.textLeft: It remains to be seen whether or not
the students' perceptions of us will change.

group_1.textRight: That's true...
So when I first heard my students mention@Magical Girls, I was genuinely surprised.
Especially since that's been Professor Satomi's@area of research for quite some time.

group_1.textLeft: But there are so many Magical Girls just in the@town of Yukuni alone.
How come they aren't known worldwide?

group_1.textRight: Hypothetically, I'd say one major reason is their@susceptibility to being misunderstood.

group_1.textLeft: Misunderstood?

group_1.textRight: As I mentioned earlier, Magical Girls protect@people from Witches,
but that comes with the sad truth that they@eventually become more Witches themselves.
Consequently, they often get demonized through@the logic that without them,
there would be no Witches around.

group_1.textLeft: But if they willingly become Magical Girls@despite knowing the risks...
Then they can't really complain about being@blamed, can they?

group_1.textRight: The truth is, hardly any girl makes the contract
with the knowledge that she'll become a Witch.

group_1.textLeft: Then, what the Magical Girls who came to our show@before were saying...

group_1.textRight: It was probably true.
Every Magical Girl grapples with life-sized worries@just like everyone else,
from career aspirations and dreams to their@relationships with family and friends.
Faced with the heavy weight of insurmountable,@helpless emotions,
they enter into a contract and become Magical Girls@in hopes of escaping their troubles.
A girl who's offered a contract while suffering from@illness or an accident
wouldn't have any breathing room to even consider@the prospect of becoming a Witch, would she?

group_1.textLeft: They pressure you into signing the contract when@you can't make that kind of accurate judgment?

group_1.textRight: Kyubey, the entity you make the contract with,@stops at nothing to achieve its goals.

group_1.textLeft: Y-Yes, I guess that's true...

group_1.textRight: Perhaps it's due to these circumstances that many@of the children who become Magical Girls,
while it's difficult to generalize, do often tend@to be pure-hearted.
That includes the Magical Girls who appeared on@this show the other night.

group_1.textLeft: Right, they admitted it was all their fault for the@Festival incident.

group_1.textRight: Regardless of any of their attempts to articulate,
it may just seem like self-serving manipulation@when spoken by those involved.
In their own way, they sacrificed themselves to@provide solace to the victims of this accident,
and to shield other Magical Girls from undergoing@further suffering.

group_1.textLeft: That's too miserable!

group_1.textRight: So that's how we end up with the situation@Professor Satomi described earlier.
Precisely.
The Magical Girls themselves end up disappearing@into the shadows of history.

group_1.textLeft: Isn't there anything we can do...?

group_1.textRight: Please, I hope people can show a little more@kindness towards Magical Girls.
I want those around us to be kind enough to@prevent increasing the number of Magical Girls.
That's all we can do for now.

group_1.textLeft: Okay, if you have any final words, please.

group_1.narration: "If the quantity of girls turning into Witches@is increasing as a result of the anti-Magical Girl@ostracism in Yukuni, then we should expect a rise in@all kinds of damage in this town."

"However, I'd appreciate it if you'd consider that neither@the Magical Girls themselves nor those who ostracized@them are the root cause, but rather the environment@that breeds various troubles and suffering."
"Additionally, given that only Magical Girls can@remedy the town's dire situation, I hope you will@turn to them for help, even if you remain unconvinced."
"Because that's the most effective way@to minimize the damage."

group_1.textLeft: Phew...

group_1.textRight: Welcome back, Professor.

group_1.textLeft: Ah, Rabi-chan. I'm back.

group_1.textRight: Thank you so much for today.@Your help means a lot to us.

group_1.textLeft: I'm doing what I can, but the outcome@remains uncertain.

group_1.textRight: Even so, having someone who genuinely cares@about us by our side is reassuring.
Just having that reality in front of me makes@me happy.

group_1.textLeft: Another suicide occurred today.
Now that everyone understands the situation,@it's up to you guys to take it from here.

group_1.textRight: Understood.
